20101205060043.000|20101205060045.000|CCO|>> IT WAS A STUNNING SUMMER
20101205060045.000|20101205060047.000|CCO|NIGHT.
20101205060047.000|20101205060049.000|CCO|THE MOON WAS OUT.
20101205060049.000|20101205060051.000|CCO|BEAUTIFUL FULL MOON.
20101205060051.000|20101205060053.500|CCO|I'M STILL AFRAID DURING FULL
20101205060053.500|20101205060056.000|CCO|MOONS.
20101205060056.000|20101205060058.500|CCO|NOT REALLY AFRAID OF THE MOON,
20101205060058.500|20101205060101.000|CCO|BUT JUST THAT SOMETHING BAD
20101205060101.000|20101205060106.000|CCO|COULD HAPPEN DURING A FULL MOON.
20101205060106.000|20101205060111.000|CCO|ON AUGUST 28, 1996, I WENT OUT
20101205060111.000|20101205060113.500|CCO|ON A DATE WITH ZACH.
20101205060113.500|20101205060116.000|CCO|IT WAS THE VERY FIRST TIME HE'D
20101205060116.000|20101205060118.500|CCO|ASKED ME OUT ON A DATE, AND A
20101205060118.500|20101205060121.000|CCO|PART OF ME JUST THOUGHT, "WHY
20101205060121.000|20101205060123.500|CCO|WOULD I GO ON A DATE WITH YOU?
20101205060123.500|20101205060126.000|CCO|YOU'RE MY ZACH.
20101205060126.000|20101205060128.500|CCO|YOU'RE MY FRIEND."
20101205060128.500|20101205060131.000|CCO|BUT THEN I THOUGHT,
20101205060131.000|20101205060133.500|CCO|"ABSOLUTELY."
20101205060133.500|20101205060136.000|CCO|WE JUST STARTED DRIVING UP THE
20101205060136.000|20101205060138.500|CCO|CANYON.
20101205060138.500|20101205060141.000|CCO|I REMEMBER FEELING THAT LITTLE
20101205060141.000|20101205060143.500|CCO|TWINGE OF EXCITEMENT WHEN YOU
20101205060143.500|20101205060146.000|CCO|REALIZE YOU REALLY HAVE A CRUSH
20101205060146.000|20101205060148.500|CCO|ON SOMEONE AND THAT THEY HAVE A
20101205060148.500|20101205060151.000|CCO|CRUSH ON YOU.
20101205060151.000|20101205060153.500|CCO|ZACH SNARR MADE ME LAUGH, AND
20101205060153.500|20101205060156.000|CCO|THAT CONNECTED US FROM THE VERY
20101205060156.000|20101205060158.500|CCO|BEGINNING.
20101205060158.500|20101205060201.000|CCO|IN HIGH SCHOOL, WE JUST... IT
20101205060201.000|20101205060203.000|CCO|SEEMED LIKE WE HAD EVERY CLASS
20101205060203.000|20101205060205.000|CCO|TOGETHER, AND HE'D ALWAYS HAVE
20101205060205.000|20101205060207.000|CCO|SOME SMART-ALECK REMARK TO MAKE
20101205060207.000|20101205060209.000|CCO|WHEN I WALKED IN THE CLASSROOM.
20101205060209.000|20101205060211.000|CCO|AND I THINK I STARTED TO LOOK
20101205060211.000|20101205060213.500|CCO|FORWARD TO THOSE COMMENTS, TO
20101205060213.500|20101205060216.000|CCO|SEE WHAT WOULD HE SAY ABOUT ME

20101205060223.500|20101205060226.000|CCO|KISS TONIGHT.

20101205060616.000|20101205060621.000|CCO|BRIGHT, BRIGHT LIGHTS, PUNGENT
20101205060621.000|20101205060623.500|CCO|ACIDDY SMELL IN THE AIR, AND MY
20101205060623.500|20101205060626.000|CCO|EARS JUST STARTED RINGING.
20101205060626.000|20101205060628.500|CCO|I DON'T KNOW WHERE THE FIRST
20101205060628.500|20101205060631.000|CCO|BULLET HIT ME BUT MY BODY JUST
20101205060631.000|20101205060633.500|CCO|FELL DOWN.
20101205060633.500|20101205060636.000|CCO|THEN IT'S SILENT FOR A MINUTE.
20101205060636.000|20101205060638.500|CCO|AND THEN I REMBER THINKING

20101205060643.000|20101205060645.000|CCO|AND IT TURNS OUT, THAT THE MAN
20101205060645.000|20101205060647.000|CCO|IS RELOADING HIS GUN, AND HE'S
20101205060647.000|20101205060649.000|CCO|GETTING BULLETS OUT OF HIS

20101205060651.000|20101205060653.500|CCO|GUN.
20101205060653.500|20101205060656.000|CCO|THEN THREE OR FOUR MORE SHOTS,
20101205060656.000|20101205060658.500|CCO|AND IT IS REALLY CLOSE AND I CAN

20101205060706.000|20101205060711.000|CCO|THEN HE STOPS FINALLY.

20101205060713.500|20101205060716.000|CCO|ALL I COULD THINK OF IN MY MIND

20101205060721.000|20101205060723.500|CCO|NEED TO HOLD STILL AND PLAY
20101205060723.500|20101205060726.000|CCO|DEAD."

20101205060728.500|20101205060731.000|CCO|DIDN'T CLOSE MY EYES AND I
20101205060731.000|20101205060733.500|CCO|STAYEDS STILL AS I COULD, AND
20101205060733.500|20101205060736.000|CCO|WHEN HE MOVED MY BODY, I JUST
20101205060736.000|20101205060738.500|CCO|LET IT MOVE WITH HIM.
20101205060738.500|20101205060741.000|CCO|BECAUSE I NEED TO BE DEAD FOR
20101205060741.000|20101205060746.000|CCO|HIM.

20101205060757.000|20101205060759.000|CCO|HE'S GOING TO RAPE ME."

20101205060801.000|20101205060803.500|CCO|THAN WHAT HE HAD JUST DONE TO

20101205061106.000|20101205061111.000|CCO|>> SHE WAS IN SHOCK, BUT SHE WAS
20101205061111.000|20101205061113.500|CCO|ABLE TO HOLD A CONVERSATION.
